About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

Innovative and effective Performance Marketing is the driving force of our success. We take a data-driven approach to connect the customer's intent to the right inventory in our marketplace. We believe in building scalable channels, by working in cross-functional teams (Product, Engineering, Data Science, Content, Design) to build the best marketing automation in the industry. We are looking for an outstanding Data Analyst - Paid Search to join our Berlin HQ. Be a part of one of Berlin's most innovative and cutting-edge Performance Marketing teams and gain exposure to a large scale, highly automated marketing engine.

You Will

Support data-driven decision-making around steering and bidding.
Regularly monitor and analyze the performance of our paid search campaigns, focusing on profitability and growth to identify opportunities for optimisation.
Analyze trends, including seasonality and market-specific behaviors, to identify and remove inefficiencies in our spent allocation.
Collaborate with the team to design and execute A/B tests to measure the impact of new bidding strategies and tactics. Analyze test results and translate them into actionable insights.
Work closely with Data Science and other Business Units on topics such as bids elasticity, CLV, and revenue maturation modeling.

Who You Are

You bring 3-5 years of experience interpreting data in Marketing Analytics, Business Intelligence or a related field.
Prior exposure to Paid Search, Bidding, and Marketing KPIs is a strong plus.
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks).
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers.
You are an excellent communicator who can present complex data findings to cross-functional teams in fluent English. 
You want to work in a fast-paced environment, balance multiple priorities and use your own initiative.

How We Set You Up For Success

Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies

And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal-opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Important notice: Protect yourself from recruitment scams

We want to ensure your safety during the application process. Please be aware of potential scammers impersonating GetYourGuide recruiters. Remember, GetYourGuide never requests payment or sensitive personal information during recruitment. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our Careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to jobs@getyourguide.com. Stay vigilant and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

job_description:
Wir gehören zu den Top-Adressen in der IT-Welt und fokussieren uns auf die Optimierung der Kerngeschäftsprozesse unserer Kunden. Durch den smarten Einsatz maßgeschneiderter IT-Lösungen unterstützen wir unsere Kunden dabei, das Beste aus ihrem Business und aktuellen Technologien herauszuholen. Unseren Erfolg aber erreichen wir nur durch eins: die Menschen bei adesso! Sie bringen Ideen, fachliches Know how und Technologien zusammen. Gemeinsam programmieren wir (deine) Zukunft bei adesso.

Standorte

Berlin, Köln, Düsseldorf, Hamburg, Dortmund, Frankfurt, München, Leipzig, Jena

DEINE ROLLE - DAS WARTET AUF DICH

Bist du bereit, die Marketingstrategien unserer Kunden durch datengetriebene Einsichten neu zu definieren? Außerdem zeichnet dich eine starke Lösungsorientierung aus? Dann bist du bei adesso genau richtig!

In deiner Rolle als Data Analyst spielst du eine zentrale Rolle bei der Einführung der Salesforce Data Cloud bei unseren Kunden.

Im Detail übernimmst du dabei folgende Aufgaben:

Kundenberatung und Datenanalyse: Du berätst Kunden bei der Einführung der Salesforce Data Cloud und identifizierst durch die Analyse vorhandener Kundendaten datengetriebene Marketing-Use Cases.
Kundendatenstrategie und Implementierung: Du entwickelst in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden eine umfassende Kundendatenstrategie, die auf den identifizierten Use Cases basiert, und bist für die Implementierung des Datenmodells in der Salesforce Data Cloud verantwortlich.
Technische Integration und Segmentierung: Du gewährleistest eine optimale Verknüpfung von Business-Anforderungen mit technischen Datenmodellen und erstellst technische Segmente, um spezifische Marketing-Use Cases zu unterstützen.
Presales und Projektverantwortung: Du unterstützt Presales-Aktivitäten, erstellst Pitch-Konzepte und präsentierst diese vor potenziellen Kunden. Zudem übernimmst du die Verantwortung für die erfolgreiche Umsetzung und Implementierung der Projekte im Auftrag unserer Kunden.

DEINE SKILLS - DAS BRINGST DU MIT

Erfahrung: Du bringst mehrjährige Erfahrung als Data Analyst mit, idealerweise in Digital Analytics oder Marketing Analytics. Erfahrungen mit Verhaltensdaten im Digitalbereich oder Customer Data im Marketing sind wünschenswert.
Kenntnisse in Datenplattformen: Du hast Kenntnisse in Customer Data Platforms, Kenntnisse der Salesforce Data Cloud sind ein zusätzlicher Vorteil.
Digitales Marketing und Analytische Fähigkeiten: Du besitzt ein fundiertes Verständnis für digitales Marketing und bist erfahren in der Analyse und Interpretation von Daten sowie in der Identifikation von datengetriebenen Use Cases.
Kundendatenstrategie und Technische Fähigkeiten: Du hast Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Implementierung von Kundendatenstrategien und verfügst über ein tiefes Verständnis von relationalen Datenmodellen sowie hervorragende SQL-Fähigkeiten.
Kommunikation und Teamarbeit: Du kannst komplexe technische Inhalte klar vermitteln und arbeitest effektiv sowohl in interdisziplinären Teams als auch selbstständig.

Unser Versprechen: Du wirst dich bei uns wohlfühlen! Kollegial, familiär und auf Augenhöhe – wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Diversität und verschiedene Blickwinkel werden bei uns genauso geschätzt wie du als Mensch. Das und viel mehr steht für unser ganz besonderes Wir-Gefühl. Für das es sogar ein Wort gibt: adessi.

Unsere Kultur und das Zusammenarbeiten sind geprägt von gegenseitiger Wertschätzung, Anerkennung und Unterstützung. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So belegen wir zum wiederholten Mal den 1. Platz beim Wettbewerb „Deutschlands Beste Arbeitgeber in der ITK“!. Unser umfangreiches Trainingsangebot und ein transparentes Laufbahnstufenmodell für alle sorgen dafür, dass deine Entwicklung bei uns nicht stillsteht. Denn gemeinsam zu wachsen und Chancengeber zu sein, das ist programmiert in unserer DNA.

Design metrics to measure the success of key features
Create visualizations to highlight trends and user behavior

Organize and prioritize tasks of our data analytics roadmap

Why you will love it 

Your work will contribute to helping millions of people enjoy lovely outdoor experiences
We've been a remote-working company since 2017, meaning: We are remote by default, have frameworks and systems in place, and know how to do it well

Requirements

You'll be successful in this role if you

Have 3+ years of experience with product analytics, including funnel analysis, cohort analysis, retention analysis, and A/B testing
Have excellent SQL skills and you're comfortable working with a cloud data warehouse (e.g. Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery)
Know how to use Python/Pandas for data analysis and you have some experience with software development workflows (e.g. version control, code review)
Have experience using dbt for data transformation and modeling (good to have, this will help you a lot working in our environment) 
Have a good grasp on statistical concepts and you know how to apply them to real-world scenarios (e.g. hypothesis testing)
Can effectively communicate data topics and analysis results (e.g. visualization, dashboard design) and you can explain complex ideas in clear and simple language
Have a deep understanding of data quality and reliability of results
Know how to understand business needs and translate abstract problems into technical solutions
Can apply rigorous analytical thinking and you have a passion for finding actionable insights

job_title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Digital Marketing
job_description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

At Vinted, our Digital Marketing Data Science & Analytics team is pivotal in driving growth through data-driven decision-making and enabling high-stake investment decisions. This team comprises talented individuals with backgrounds in academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media. They use scientific approaches to solve complex business problems, develop statistical and business models, perform advanced data analyses, and ensure data reliability.

Within Marketing, we currently have exciting opportunities for Decision Scientists to work with either CRM or Performance Marketing teams.

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) department we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:

Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making. 
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms. 
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines. 

In this position, you’ll

Set up untracked marketing experiments: Use Geo experiments, causal impact, or diff-in-diff methodologies to measure the incremental impact of different marketing channels and campaigns
Experimentation: Analyse AB tests and iterate on the experiment set up and automated testing tools
Revenue Stream Analysis: Investigate revenue streams generated by marketing, including acquisition, reactivation, and engagement. 
Marketing Channel Analysis: Assess the impact of various marketing channels on user acquisition, retention, engagement, and revenue. 
Support Media Mix Modeling: Occasionally assist with ad-hoc requests, including data questions, consultations, and analyses. 
Segmentation: Develop unique personas to enable relevant and personalised comms to millions of Vinted users
Analytical deep dives: answer complex questions such as: when is the best time to reach out to our customers? What is the best mix of different messages and amount of communications? What is the total impact of all communications?

About You

General Requirements:

Several years of experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role. 
Strong business results orientation with the ability to connect scientific approaches with pragmatic problem-solving. 
Excellent communication skills to present results persuasively to various stakeholders. 
Proficiency in at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab, etc.)
Fluency in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau). 
A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business, or a related field. 
Excellent written and spoken English. 

Nice To Have Skills (not All Necessary)

Strong experimentation knowledge from CRM or Product background;
Good understanding of performance marketing channels attribution;
Causal inference and geo experimentation experience

Work perks

The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will

Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role

Who You Are

5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Previous experience in marketing attribution and paid search. 
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice to have

Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus

Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget

Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
